website_summaries.verdict: The Vibram FiveFingers Seeya is very light and highly flexible that will not disappoint runners in getting the barefoot running experience. It has an impressive traction, minimal support, and little foot protection. It also received negative comments because others found it to be less durable and uncomfortable. In summary, the shoe still needs some improvement but it is still worth-trying.
pros: The shoe is very light and very flexible, according to some reviews
It has an impressive ground feel, said most runners
The upper of the Vibram FiveFingers Seeya features a polyester stretch fabric that is very lightweight and thin
Some runners were impressed by the grip of the Seeyah especially when used in wet condition
cons: The shoe materials were not very durable according to some reviews
Toes were uncomfortable based on some runners’ feedback
Some runners were not impressed by the top strap
it failed to provide a tight fit
The heel area felt loose, said some reviews

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON / AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: So my brand new pair broke after just two uses. Strap came off in a clean split. Posted on Vibram's FB page and they said to contact the retailer (amazon only has a 30 day return/exchange policy, so that would be a no-go) and if that didn't work to call their customer service. So I call and the girl tells me Amazon is NOT an authorized seller in their book and as a result there is absolutely NO WARRANTY AT ALL against faulty products. So I'm SOL. This was my first pair of FiveFingers and I promise you it is also my last. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Ben B in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for men
customer_reviews.text: this my second pair (first one lasted ~10 years) I use them strickly for running and they are the best running shoes you can buy for money, after u get used to them. Just make sure you store them cold and dry (like you should dowith all glues plactic shoes), best for long term storage is the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Arndt Andresen

customer_reviews.title: You need to try these on before you decide on ...
customer_reviews.text: You need to try these on before you decide on a size. Don't know about the recent lawsuit against these guys, but I have been nursing a full bucket handle tear in my rt miniscus and this is the only shoes that keeps the knee from hurting. Tried all the cushioning and stability shoes and they all hurt my knee. These keep you from heel striking so your joints don't have to absorb any beating. I go up to 8 miles, but you will feel every sharp pebble.
customer_reviews.author: R.H.

customer_reviews.title: Not an "All Weather" Shoe in the Long Term
customer_reviews.text: All up, a great runner. However, I expected them to last longer. I've had to superglue the rubber sole back to the upper in various places, especially around the edges. Looking for a new, heavier duty style at the moment. For the record, I run on pavement, grass, wet sand, dry sand, over rocks, and through the ocean. That might make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Z

customer_reviews.title: perfect for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I like my Vibram shoes. I do not recommend wearing them on concrete floor for 12hr. but hiking off of pavement they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ken

customer_reviews.title: almost barefoot
customer_reviews.text: Good for feeling almost barefoot, but avoiding scratches. My feet needed some breaking-in though, until skin becomes stronger and chafing stops.
customer_reviews.author: scoutcat

customer_reviews.title: Gosh!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love them, color i got was black/dayglow but i loved it. its comfortable, certainly ordering more for sure.
customer_reviews.author: OseAlex

customer_reviews.title: looked great but....
customer_reviews.text: the shoes would have been perfect if they would come in 1/2 sizes, because they were too big.
customer_reviews.author: Jessieg

customer_reviews.title: size matters
customer_reviews.text: somewhat tight wish it was listed in vibram size not European size. Should streach out enough that it is not worth returning for me
customer_reviews.author: brian peltier

customer_reviews.title: First time but best time
customer_reviews.text: New Vibram customer. Best decision as my distance has increased and my body has adjusted. Can't wait for my next run.
customer_reviews.author: Cy

customer_reviews.title: Decent alternate to the original Bikila's
customer_reviews.text: Next to the original Bikila's, these are my favorite running shoes. The liner is a bit less cushy, but they are easier to put on. Noticed the liner difference mainly on a twenty miler, and as they break in and my feet get used to them that issue may well resolve.
customer_reviews.author: ErgoGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother. Normally he uses the same size for his other Vibram. I also use the same size, and it fits very well. Amazon delivered it very well. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I love the shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoes, they are great for working out and lifting. The only drawback was that they seem to stretch out a bit and are now slightly too large.
customer_reviews.author: The Ruley Parade

customer_reviews.title: like em but make sure you size correctly
customer_reviews.text: Good price and thus good deal but you should definitely make sure you get the correct size. I wear an 11 in normal/casual shoes and an 11 in these were huge. Probably needed a 10 or 10.5
customer_reviews.author: A. F. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THESE VIBRAMS - FLIMSY  STRAP WILL BREAK
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair of Vibrams for me. Bought them in January. Wore them for the 3rd time today and the joint in the velcro strap came apart. Now they are telling me that it is too late to return or repair. This will be my last pair of Vibrams and last time with this retailer. The strap is just plain flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: W. Baker

product_meta.title: Vibram FiveFingers Seeya Running Shoes
product_meta.description: The Vibram FiveFingers Seeya Running Shoes are ultra-streamlined and designed to bring you even closer to the barefoot sensation. The over all weight has been reduced and a mesh upper has been introduced to provide breathability. Providing the minimum rubber thickness in the outsole maximises foot feel and flexibility, while the soft midsole reduces the thickness and weight as well as allowing natural movement. Featuring a lightweight stretched mesh upper which has a seamless collar and adjustable hook-and-loop closure to provide a snug fit. The stitched-in insole protects against skin and foot irritations over longer runs.
feature_bullets: Minimum Rubber Outsole - Maximising the "foot Feel" and flexibility.
Soft TPU Midsole - Reducing the thickness and weight, while enhancing natural movement and barefoot sensation.
Stretch Mesh - Featured on the upper with a seamless collar and a hook-and-loop fastening systems, providing a snug fit.
Stitched-in Insole - Protects the feet against irritations on long runs.
